results.title: At whose door
results.creator_credit: Max Anderson, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: This film deals with the problems of accident prevention in the British iron and steel industry. Demonstrates that accidents do not merely happen- they are caused, not always by one individual or one mistake but by a combination of circumstances which could have been foreseen. Illustrations include: faulty handling of materials or tools, falling or knocking against equipment, untidy workshops, bad stacking or storing, neglect and carelessness.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 3
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Center. In this part, work begins on a spacious community igloo. When the men return to their hunt, the women continue with their work and play games with the children. A seal is dragged into the igloo to be shared by everyone including the dogs, who are called in to clean up. (Award: Parno)

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. This film show life at the campsite. Children amuse themselves with makeshift toys. Women tend their children, make clothes, and repair the igloos. When the men return with their catch, everyone goes inside where work, story-telling and games occupy each one’s time. Award: Parno. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: At the winter sea ice camp. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In late winter when the cold is severe, the inuit stop their trek and make camp. The men cut blocks for an igloo while the women shovel the site. During the day, the men sit patiently on the ice, waiting for seals. (Award: Parno)

results.title: At the spring sea ice camp. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, Quentin Brown and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Netsilik Inuit Eskimo families travel across the sea ice. Before night falls, they build igloos. A boy practices spear throwing at a figure built in the snow while a woman crimps the sole of a sealskin boot.

results.title: At the sign of the owl
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean, R. Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the activities of the Council of Adult Education in organising cultural activities throughout Victoria, showing particularly the annual Summer School conducted at Albury. The school extends over ten days and provides opportunities for the study of art and crafts, music, opera and drama.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Dean, R. Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Herschells Films

results.title: At the foot of Mt Fuji
results.brief_description: A day in the life of a ten year old child who lives in a small town at the base of Mt Fuji in Japan, is revealed in his letter to a pen pal in the United States. Suitable for Early-Middle Primary students. No other credits available.

results.title: At the caribou crossing place. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Part of a series on the Netsilik Inuit as documented by the Education Development Center. In this part, two men join the four people at camp. The men build a row of inukshuit, manlike figures which they use to deflect the oncoming caribou into the water, where they are subsequently speared and floated ashore. A great feast follows.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith, Education Development Center and ONF | NFB
